title: Social Education Curriculum for Enhancing Academic Well-Being via Live Webcasts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in online learning platforms and foundational social studies knowledge
context.additional_context: Live webcast-based social education utilizing non-real-time LMS in digital device-provided environments, requiring customized design to strengthen the 7 elements of academic well-being (empathy, support, responsiveness, trustworthiness, tangibility, self-efficacy, resilience)

learning_goals: Learners can recognize and self-diagnose the seven key elements of academic well-being in a live webcast environment.
Learners can implement at least three interaction strategies with peers and instructors using LMS-based collaborative tools.
Learners can establish and execute a personalized resilience plan for managing academic stress over eight weeks.
Learners can propose feedback mechanisms incorporating academic well-being elements when designing webcast lesson materials.

resources: LMS Platform (Integrated with Video Conferencing System)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
